triples.name: Social media
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes political polarization across social media platforms as the primary research environment.

triples.name: Political polarization
triples.relevance: Political polarization is the central conceptual framework and subject matter of the research.

triples.name: Homophily
triples.relevance: Homophily is used to measure interactional polarization through analysis of homophilic versus heterophilic user interactions.

triples.name: Facebook
triples.relevance: Facebook is one of the three social media platforms analyzed in the cross-platform comparison.

triples.name: Twitter
triples.relevance: Twitter is one of the three social media platforms analyzed in the cross-platform comparison.

triples.name: WhatsApp
triples.relevance: WhatsApp is one of the three social media platforms analyzed in the cross-platform comparison.

triples.name: Sentiment analysis
triples.relevance: Sentiment analysis is used to measure affective polarization by analyzing emotions and attitudes expressed in social media.

triples.name: Social network analysis
triples.relevance: Social network analysis is used to examine interactional structures and relationships between users across platforms.

triples.name: Affective polarization
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel comprehensive framework measuring three dimensions of polarization including affective polarization as a distinct component of online political polarization.
